subject: Web3
title: Privacy vs. Surveillance
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Privacy vs. Surveillance.

hook.text: Financial privacy is a human right. Preventing crime requires surveillance. Crypto law must balance both.

buildup.text: Privacy coins like Monero and Zcash offer anonymity. Governments want to ban them. Users argue they protect civil liberties.

discovery.text: The EU considered banning privacy coins under anti-money laundering rules. Some exchanges already delisted them preemptively.

twist.text: Cash is completely private. Nobody asks what you spent your dollars on. Yet digital privacy is treated as suspicious.

climax.text: The future of crypto law will define how much financial privacy citizens retain in an increasingly digital economy.

punchline.text: Cash is private. Digital money is tracked. The law will decide where crypto falls.

quiz.question: Why is the privacy debate important for crypto regulation?
options: It determines how much financial privacy citizens retain in a digital economy
